8.speaker: sloth
8.japanese: いつも　笹子さんに

9.speaker: sloth
9.japanese: いろんなとこに連れていってもらってるんです

11.speaker: sloth
11.english: I thought that I'd like to go... to the hot springs on my own two feet for once...

16.speaker: panda
16.japanese: ナマケモノ君　僕も行くよ

17.speaker: penguin
17.japanese: ホットティーちょうだい
17.english: Could I get a hot tea?

18.speaker: penguin
18.japanese: ハチミツたっぷり入れて
18.english: Put plenty of honey in it.

19.speaker: sasako
19.japanese: 今日はカフェモカじゃないんですか
19.english: You're not getting a café mocha today?

20.speaker: penguin
20.japanese: ハチミツ入り紅茶は　ノドにいいからね
20.english: Well, hot tea with honey in it is very good for your throat.

22.speaker: penguin
22.english: No. It's been in a while, so I thought I'd go...

27.speaker: polar bear
27.japanese: ペンギンさん 行くの　１人カラオケ
27.english: Are you going to one-person karaoke, Mr. Penguin?

28.speaker: penguin
28.japanese: うん　死ぬほど歌おうかと思って
28.english: Yeah. I'm thinking about singing my lungs out.

29.speaker: polar bear
29.japanese: いいね　早速行こう

30.speaker: penguin
30.japanese: ちょっと待って　シロクマ君
30.english: Hold on a sec, Polar Bear.

31.japanese: ２人で行ったら １人カラオケにならないじゃない
31.english: If we both go, then it won't be one-person karaoke.

32.speaker: polar bear
32.japanese: 大丈夫　違う部屋に入るから
32.english: Don't worry. I'll get my own room.

35.speaker: polar bear
35.japanese: 行っちゃう　行っちゃう

37.speaker: penguin
37.japanese: 急ごう もう歌いたくてたまらないよ
37.english: Let's hurry. I want to sing so bad, it's killing me.

40.japanese: どっか　その辺にカラオケボックスないかな
40.english: I wonder if there's a karaoke bar close by.

42.speaker: penguin
42.japanese: えっ　どこ　カラオケボックスあった
42.english: Where? Was there a karaoke bar somewhere?

43.speaker: penguin
43.japanese: あれ　パンダ君とナマケモノ君だ

44.speaker: penguin
44.japanese: まぁいいや カラオケボックスに急ごう　シロクマ君
44.english: Well, whatever. Let's hurry to the karaoke bar, Polar Bear.

46.speaker: panda
46.japanese: ナマケモノ君と温泉に行くんだ
46.english: I'm going to the hot springs with Sloth.

48.speaker: panda
48.japanese: ナマケモノ君と温泉に行くんだ
48.english: I'm going to the hot springs with Sloth.

49.speaker: penguin
49.japanese: あぁ　そう　駅まで送ろうか
49.english: Oh, I see. Do you want us to take you to the station?

50.speaker: panda
50.japanese: ううん　歩いて行くんだ

51.speaker: penguin
51.japanese: 電車で行けばいいじゃない
51.english: You should just take the train.

52.speaker: panda
52.japanese: 自分で歩いて行きたいんだって
52.english: He says he wants to walk.

53.speaker: penguin
53.japanese: あぁ　そう　変わってるな
53.english: Oh, I see. Well, that's different.

54.speaker: penguin
54.japanese: じゃあ　シロクマ君…

55.speaker: polar bear
55.english: Let's go to the hot springs.

57.speaker: polar bear
57.japanese: さぁ　温泉　温泉
57.english: All right! Hot springs! Hot springs!

60.speaker: penguin
60.japanese: ねぇ　ナマケモノ君 もう少しペース上げてかない
60.english: Hey, Sloth, how about we pick up the pace?

61.speaker: panda
61.japanese: ナマケモノ君は　歩くことだけに体力のすべてを使いたいから
61.english: Sloth said he wants to use all of his energy for walking,

62.speaker: panda
62.english: so he's not going to speak.

66.speaker: panda
66.japanese: あそこに　コロッケ売ってるよ
66.english: They're selling croquettes over there. They're so good!

67.speaker: polar bear
67.japanese: 歩きながら食べるコロッケは最高だね
67.english: Eating croquettes while walking is the best.

68.speaker: penguin
68.japanese: その最高のコロッケは僕のおごりだってことを
68.english: And I'd like to mention that I paid for those croquettes you called the best.

69.speaker: polar bear
69.japanese: ナマケモノ君は食べなくていいの
69.english: Don't you need to eat, Sloth?

70.speaker: panda
70.japanese: ナマケモノ君は　歩くことだけに体力のすべてを使いたいから
70.english: Sloth said he wants to use all of his energy for walking,

71.speaker: panda
71.english: so he's not going to eat.

72.speaker: polar bear
72.japanese: 食べないなら　ナマケモノ君の分は僕が食べてもいいよ
72.english: If he's not going to eat, I can eat his share instead.

74.speaker: penguin
74.japanese: それ　コロッケをおごった僕が賛同すると思うの
74.english: You think the person who bought the croquettes is supposed to approve?

75.speaker: penguin
75.japanese: シロクマ君　ついに　カラオケボックスだよ
75.english: We're finally at the karaoke bar, Polar Bear.

77.speaker: penguin
77.japanese: 先の温泉より　今　ここにあるカラオケボックスじゃないかな
77.english: Instead of the hot springs up ahead, I think we should focus on the karaoke bar that's right here.

78.speaker: polar bear
78.japanese: 先の温泉　先の温泉
78.english: Hot springs up ahead! Hot springs up ahead! Hot springs up ahead, huh?

79.speaker: penguin
79.japanese: ねぇ　あんまり進んでないよ
79.english: Hey, we haven't gotten very far.

81.speaker: penguin
81.japanese: キミはこういうの気にならないんだね
81.english: You don't seem too concerned about that.

82.speaker: penguin
82.japanese: シロクマ君　ナマケモノ君を運んであげて
82.english: Polar Bear, could you carry Sloth?

85.speaker: penguin
85.japanese: けど　これじゃ　いつまでたっても温泉につかないじゃない
85.english: But at this rate, we'll never get to the hot springs.

87.speaker: polar bear
87.japanese: 旅の目的は早く着くことじゃないよ
87.english: The goal of this trip is not to get there quickly.

88.speaker: polar bear
88.english: You have to enjoy the things on the way.

92.speaker: panda
92.japanese: ペンギンさんに　あとは任せて
92.english: I'm going to leave the rest to you, Mr. Penguin,

93.japanese: 僕はあっちに歩いていくよ
93.english: and I'm going to start walking that way.

102.speaker: penguin
102.japanese: 旅は途中が楽しいんでしょ
102.english: The stuff on the way is what's fun about trips, right?

105.speaker: sloth
105.japanese: 温泉じゃないけど 初めて自分の足で来ました
105.english: It's not a hot spring... but this is the first time I've gotten here by myself...

109.speaker: polar bear
109.japanese: 本当だね ナマケモノ君に感謝だね
109.english: It was. We should thank Sloth.

110.speaker: penguin
110.japanese: そうだね　遠くに行くだけが旅じゃないんだね
110.english: Yeah. I guess just going far doesn't make a trip.

111.speaker: polar bear
111.japanese: 違う景色を見ることが旅なんだね
111.english: Seeing new sights is the trip.

113.speaker: panda
113.japanese: ナマケモノ君出てこないね

114.speaker: polar bear
114.english: I'm starting to feel cold after the bath.

115.speaker: panda
115.japanese: シロクマ君も湯冷めするの
115.english: You feel cold after baths, too, Polar Bear?

116.speaker: polar bear
116.english: Chills after a baths is more just being cold.

117.speaker: penguin
117.english: Chills after a bath are universal.

118.speaker: panda
118.japanese: ペンギンさん　ダッシュで様子を見てきてよ
118.english: You should rush in and see what he's doing, Mr. Penguin.

119.speaker: penguin
119.japanese: ダッシュする意味あるの
119.english: Is there a point to rushing in there?

122.speaker: penguin
122.english: All right. We can finally go to the karaoke bar... Yes... Let's go to the hot springs...

123.speaker: penguin
123.japanese: えっ　カラオケじゃないの
123.english: What?! We're not going to karaoke?!

124.speaker: sloth
124.japanese: 自分の足で　どうしても温泉に行きたいんです
124.english: I want to go to the hot springs by my own two feet... no matter what...

125.speaker: penguin
125.japanese: けど　銭湯でいいんじゃないかな
125.english: I think the public bath house is enough. Isn't it?

127.japanese: 遠くに行くだけが旅じゃないんじゃない
127.english: Just going far doesn't make a trip.

128.speaker: sloth
128.japanese: すっかり銭湯でリフレッシュできました
128.english: I'm completely refreshed from the bath-house...

129.speaker: sloth
129.japanese: さあ　温泉へ　レッツゴー
129.english: All right, let's go to the hot springs...

131.speaker: penguin
131.japanese: ああ こんな夜中になっちゃったよ
131.english: Jeez... I can't believe it's so late.

132.speaker: panda
132.japanese: ナマケモノ君　そろそろ寝たら
132.english: Why don't you go to sleep already, Sloth?

134.japanese: ふだん２０時間以上寝てるんでしょ
134.english: Don't you usually sleep for over twenty hours?

136.japanese: 数時間　話しかけないでください
136.english: so please don't talk to me for a few hours...

137.speaker: penguin
137.japanese: ここからすぐ 僕ん家なんだけどな
137.english: My house is right near here, too.

138.speaker: polar bear
138.japanese: ペンギンさん　パンダ君

141.speaker: polar bear
141.japanese: ナマケモノ君と来なかったら
141.english: If we hadn't come with Sloth,

142.japanese: こんな景色　見られなかったね
142.english: we wouldn't have been able to see this.

144.speaker: penguin
144.japanese: けど　僕ん家すぐそこなんだよね…
144.english: But my house is right over there...

145.speaker: panda
145.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

147.speaker: panda
147.japanese: ホワイトデーに　土地の権利書くれない
147.english: Could you give me the title to some property for White Day?

149.speaker: penguin
149.japanese: ねぇ　今日は　なんか違うね

150.speaker: polar bear
150.japanese: このまま　『ワールド　ビジネス　サテライト』くらいまで　いくよ
150.english: And from here... We're going to jump right into World Business Satellite...

151.speaker: penguin
151.japanese: そんなに　もつかな
151.english: I wonder if we'd make it that long.

152.speaker: polar bear
152.japanese: じゃあ　『カンブリア宮殿』まで頑張るよ

153.speaker: polar bear
153.japanese: じゃあ　『カンブリア宮殿』まで頑張るよ
153.english: We'll try to make it to Cambria Palace.

157.speaker: penguin
157.japanese: 笹子さんも　そっちのチーム
157.english: Miss Sasako, you're on that team, too?

158.speaker: penguin
158.english: Let's try a little longer at least. Huh?

159.speaker: penguin
159.english: That's it! Hold it right there.

160.speaker: sasako
160.japanese: ペンギンさん　カフェモカは
160.english: Mr. Penguin, would you like a café mocha? I don't think I need one today.

161.speaker: polar bear
161.japanese: よし　グリズリー君やラマさんや
161.english: All right. Let's invite Grizzly, Mr. Llama, and the others, and have a party!

162.speaker: penguin
162.japanese: メンバーを増やすのはやめよう
162.english: We shouldn't increase the number of people we have.

163.speaker: panda
163.japanese: じゃあ みんなで草野球大会しようよ
163.english: Then let's all play field baseball!

164.speaker: penguin
164.japanese: 聞いてた　メンバーを増やすの…
164.english: Were you listening? I told you we shouldn't increase—

166.speaker: panda
166.japanese: あっ　ゾウガメさん

171.speaker: sasako
171.japanese: たしかに　いつもと違いますね
171.english: It does seem a bit different than usual.

172.speaker: penguin
172.japanese: あれ　ここ　どこ

173.speaker: polar bear
173.japanese: 「楽しいロンドン　ゆかいなロンドン」

174.speaker: panda
174.japanese: 僕たち　どうやって来たの

175.speaker: polar bear
175.japanese: どこでも行けるドアだよ
175.english: With a door that can take you anywhere.

179.speaker: sasako
179.japanese: ペンギンさん　カフェモカは
179.english: Mr. Penguin, would you like a café mocha?

180.speaker: penguin
180.english: Don't think I need one just yet.

182.speaker: polar bear
182.japanese: 「だってばよ」まで　もたないよ
182.english: Dattebayo! We won't make it until then... You have no hesitations, do you?

185.speaker: polar bear
185.english: It's an explosion! That would be the sun {\i1}(taiyou){\i0}.

186.speaker: penguin
186.english: That would be a AAA battery {\i1}(tan yon){\i0}.

192.speaker: panda
192.japanese: めんたい　めんたい　めんたい

195.speaker: sasako
195.japanese: どうぞ　カフェモカです
195.english: Here you go, a café mocha.

196.speaker: penguin
196.japanese: あれ　出しちゃった

197.speaker: sasako
197.japanese: 今日は特別サービスで…
197.english: And we have something extra special today...

199.speaker: penguin
199.japanese: 特別にいらないサービスかな
199.english: I don't think that special was necessary.

201.speaker: polar bear
201.japanese: うん　今度はクレイアニメでやろうね
201.english: Yes. Let's do claymation next time.

202.speaker: penguin
202.japanese: たぶん　やらないかな…
202.english: I don't think we'll be doing th—

205.speaker: llama
205.japanese: 半田さん　大丈夫ですか
205.english: Mr. Handa? Are you all right?

207.speaker: llama
207.japanese: どうしたんですか　半田さん

210.speaker: llama
210.japanese: 何か悩みがあったら 聞きますよ
210.english: If something is troubling you, I'd be happy to listen.

211.speaker: llama
211.japanese: ラマデーを作ってくれた半田さんの力になりたいんです
211.english: I'd like to help you out since you made Llama Day.

214.speaker: handa
214.japanese: その目で見つめられると弱いな
214.english: It's hard to say no when you look at me with those eyes...

215.speaker: handa
215.japanese: 実は　来週ホワイトデーでしょ
215.english: Well, next week is White Day, right?

217.speaker: handa
217.japanese: 笹子さんへのお返し　何にしようかずっと悩んでるんだよね
217.english: I'm wondering what I should get Miss Sasako in return.

218.speaker: handa
218.japanese: 何あげたらいいと思う
218.english: What do you think I should give her?

219.speaker: llama
219.japanese: それは　ラマに聞かれてもわからないですね
219.english: I don't think a llama like myself can answer that question.

220.speaker: llama
220.japanese: 人間のことは人間に聞いたほうが
220.english: You should ask human questions to another human.

222.speaker: kirino
222.japanese: 笹子さんへのホワイトデーに 何あげるか悩んでるんですって
222.english: I heard that you're stumped on what to get Miss Sasako for White Day. How did yo—

223.speaker: handa
223.japanese: 半田さんが笹子さんにホワイトデーに何をあげたらいいか悩んでいます
223.english: "Mr. Handa is trying to figure out what to get Miss Sasako for White Day."

224.speaker: handa
224.japanese: ラマさん　なんで掲示板に貼っちゃうんですか
224.english: Mr. Llama! Why'd you put this up on the bulletin board?!

225.speaker: llama
225.japanese: 半田さん困ってたからなんとかしてあげたくて
225.english: You seemed troubled, so I wanted to help.

226.speaker: handa
226.japanese: ありがたいけど　困りますよ
226.english: I'm thankful, but this isn't good...

227.speaker: kirino
227.japanese: けど　先輩　いつの間に笹子さんにチョコレートもらったんですか
227.english: But when did you get chocolate from Miss Sasako?

229.speaker: sasako
229.japanese: これ　ちょっと遅れちゃったんだけど
229.english: This is a little late, but here, Panda, Valentine's Day chocolate.

231.speaker: sasako
231.japanese: あっ　半田さんにも渡しておいてくれる
231.english: Oh, could you give Mr. Handa his, as well?

233.speaker: llama
233.japanese: 完全な義理チョコですね

234.speaker: llama
234.japanese: 形としてはパンダ君にもらってますしね
234.english: Not to mention it was Panda who had received it.

235.speaker: kirino
235.japanese: ラマさん　言わなくていいから
235.english: You don't need to mention that, Mr. Llama.

236.speaker: llama
236.japanese: お返しは決まったんですか
236.english: Did you decide on what to get her?

237.speaker: kirino
237.japanese: 何か　候補はあるんですか
237.english: Did you think of something good?

241.speaker: kirino
241.japanese: 完全な義理チョコのお返しにバイクって
241.english: A bike in return for obligatory chocolate?

242.speaker: kirino
242.english: Are you a millionaire? I have other ideas, too.

243.speaker: handa
243.japanese: 実家から送られてきたおイモで作った　煮っころがしとか
243.english: I was thinking about making her a meat and potatoes dish with the potatoes I got from home.

247.speaker: polar bear
247.english: It's a little early, but it's almost White Day. Here's your present.

249.speaker: polar bear
249.japanese: アメで作った　ギョレメ国立公園と
249.english: It's Göreme National Park and the Rock Sites of Cappadocia made out of candy.

250.speaker: penguin
250.japanese: すごいことはすごいけど わかりにくいね
250.english: That's amazing and all, but it's hard to tell.

252.speaker: sasako
252.japanese: ありがとうございます

253.speaker: penguin
253.japanese: 笹子さん　僕もお返し

254.speaker: penguin
254.japanese: なんで笹かまぼこかは聞かないで
254.english: Don't ask me why they're bamboo grass fish cakes.

255.speaker: sasako
255.japanese: ありがとうございます

256.speaker: llama
256.japanese: いよいよ今日はホワイトデーですが お返しは決まりましたか
256.english: It's finally White Day today, but were you able to find her a present?

258.speaker: handa
258.japanese: 服とかあげるんでしょ 普通は
258.english: You usually give them clothes, right?

260.speaker: handa
260.japanese: じゃあ…　バスタオルとか

261.speaker: handa
261.japanese: あって困るもんじゃないし
261.english: Er, it's not something you can have too much of.

263.speaker: kirino
263.japanese: 水 しかも　何でその量

264.speaker: handa
264.japanese: もうわけわかんなくなっちゃって
264.english: I didn't know what to do anymore!

267.speaker: kirino
267.japanese: 普通に　マシュマロとかアメとかでいいんじゃないですか
267.english: I think sweets like marshmallows or candy would be just fine. All right. I'll do that. Polar Bear Café

268.speaker: llama
268.english: Thank you for all of your hard work.

278.speaker: penguin
278.japanese: ところで　シロクマ君

280.speaker: penguin
280.japanese: 半田さん　何してるんだろう
280.english: I have to wonder what Mr. Handa is doing.

283.speaker: polar bear
283.japanese: アメあまってるんだけど　いらない
283.english: I have left-over candy... would you like it?

284.speaker: penguin
284.japanese: 見るのが怖いな けど　いただきましょう
284.english: I'm scared to see it, but sure.

288.speaker: polar bear
288.japanese: しかも完成形　本物より早いよ
288.english: And in its finished form. Got it done a lot faster than the original.

289.speaker: penguin
289.japanese: アメで作らなくていいよね
289.english: You didn't have to make it out of candy.

291.speaker: sasako
291.japanese: シロクマさん　すみません

294.speaker: handa
294.japanese: どうしたんですか　お店は
294.english: What's wrong? Don't you have work?

295.speaker: sasako
295.japanese: 早退させてもらったんです

297.speaker: sasako
297.japanese: なんか　ちょっと熱っぽくて
297.english: I think I may have a fever.

299.speaker: sasako
299.japanese: ふだん　あんまりひかないんですけど
299.english: I don't usually catch them, but... Oh, I know.

300.japanese: これよかったらどうぞ

301.speaker: sasako
301.japanese: わぁ　ありがとうございます
301.english: Oh, thank you very much. I hope you feel better soon.

302.speaker: sasako
302.japanese: ありがとうございます

303.speaker: kirino
303.japanese: ホワイトデー　どうだったんですか

308.speaker: panda
308.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

310.speaker: panda
310.english: Do you know what qigong is?

312.speaker: penguin
312.japanese: そういうのやめてくれるかな

316.speaker: polar bear
316.japanese: 来週のシロクマカフェは
316.english: In next week's Polar Bear's Café,

317.speaker: polar bear
